current-chamber.#text:
IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED
		  STATES

official-title.#text:
To provide for the counting on January 4,
		  2013, of the electoral votes for President and Vice President of the United
		  States.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Vice
			 President of the United States

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be their
			 Presiding Officer; that two tellers shall be previously appointed by the
on the part of the Senate and two by the

on the
			 part of the House of Representatives, to whom shall be handed, as they are
			 opened by the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, all the certificates and papers
			 purporting to be certificates of the electoral votes, which certificates and
			 papers shall be opened, presented, and acted upon in the alphabetical order of
			 the States, beginning with the letter “A”; and said tellers, having then read
			 the same in the presence and hearing of the two Houses, shall make a list of
			 the votes as they shall appear from said certificates; and the votes having
			 been ascertained and counted in the manner and according to the rules by law
			 provided, the result of the same shall be delivered to the

, who shall thereupon announce the state of the vote, which announcement
			 shall be deemed a sufficient declaration of the persons, if any, elected

, and, together with a list of
			 the votes, be entered on the Journals of the two Houses.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Vice President of the United States

text.#text:
That provide the two Houses of Congress
			 shall meet in the Hall of the House of Representatives on Thursday, the 4th day
			 of January 2013, at 1 o’clock post meridian, pursuant to the requirements of
			 the Constitution and laws relating to the election of

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 SCON 1 ES: To provide for the counting on January 4, 2013, of the electoral votes for President and Vice President of the United States.
